description.p: Strands of the weave wrap around the target, ripping the target apart into the base elements that composed it. The target can be a creature or an object.

A creature targeted by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures painted into existence make this save with disadvantage. On a failed save, the target takes 7d6 force damage. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points and it cannot regenerate or reform.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to the elements that composed the creature. A non-painted creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

This spell automatically reduces a Large or smaller nonmagical object into the raw elements that formed the object. If the target is a Huge or larger object, this spell separates a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 3d6 for each slot level above 5th.
Moves a hand-held single object weighing up to 5 lb into an extradimensional pocket plane.
